Class MazeTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeTile

  • public class MazeTile
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.0, May 16, 2014 This program deals with all information concerning maze tiles. This program has the ability to tell other programs whether or not a particular is occupied or not, how many walls that tile has, and where those walls are located on the tile (top, sides, bottom).

    Variable Dictionary
    Name Type Purpose
    north boolean Stores whether or not the north (top) side of a maze tile has a wall or not.
    south boolean Stores whether or not the south (bottom) side of a maze tile has a wall or not.
    east boolean Stores whether or not the east (right) side of a maze tile has a wall or not.
    west boolean Stores whether or not the west (left) side of a maze tile has a wall or not.
    available boolean Stores whether or not the tile is available or not. (Available as in if the player can move onto it or not.)

    Author:
    Daniel Chen

      The purpose of this method is to remove a wall.
      void toggleVisit()
      The purpose of this method is to toggle whether or not a particular tile has been visited/occupied or not.
      java.lang.String toString()
      The purpose of this method is to return information (when called) about a particular tile.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MazeTile

        public MazeTile()
        This is the class constructor. It sets the default tile setting as having all 4 walls be present and to not be available.

    • Method Detail

      • toggleVisit

        public void toggleVisit()
        The purpose of this method is to toggle whether or not a particular tile has been visited/occupied or not.

      • isVisited

        public boolean isVisited()
        The purpose of this method is to check whether or not a particular tile is currently being visited/occupied.
        Returns:
        Whether tile is occupied or not.

      • removeWall

        public void removeWall(int n)
        The purpose of this method is to remove a wall. This ensures that the maze path is connected.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (n == 1) The purpose of this structure is to check which side of the wall is to be removed.

        Parameters:
        n - Indicates which wall is to be removed.

      • getWalls

        public boolean[] getWalls()
        The purpose of this method is to check which walls are existing on a particular tile.
        Returns:
        All four sides of a tile, indicating which ones have walls.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The purpose of this method is to return information (when called) about a particular tile.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (!north) The purpose of this structure is to check which sides of that particular tile has walls.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        result - This variable stores information about whether or not the tile has walls as a numerical value.
        Returns:
        A numerical value indicating which walls a tile has.
